III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff gave youth marijuana.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 05/17/2023. It states that Staff Person 1
bought Youth A marijuana for his birthday in 01/2023.
Complainant and Case Manager report Youth A having a history
of truanting from the facility and report Youth A truanted from the
facility for the day on his birthday. No other concerns are noted.
I reviewed Youth A’s case record. He was placed in the facility
from 10/07/2022 through 01/25/2023. Youth A has since been
placed in another facility.
I reviewed incident report dated 01/10/2023. It states Youth A and
another youth leaving the facility grounds upon transport from the
gymnasium to the housing building at 3:00PM. Staff attempted to
prevent youth from walking out the gymnasium door by standing in
front of it and very redirecting them to comply with programming.
It is noted Youth A returned to the facility at 1:00AM.
I also reviewed an incident report dated 01/08/2023. It states
Youth A and another youth AWOLed from the facility on
01/08/2023 at 12:00AM. Both returned to the facility at 5:00AM,
broke into the facility gymnasium, and stole an I-Pad. Police
responded to the alarm and the I-Pad was not located on the
youth. The police returned the youth to the facility.
I interviewed Youth A at another child caring institution with DHHS
Worker 1 on 05/19/2023. He reports previously being placed at
the facility and states he AWOLed daily and then lessened the
amount of AWOL’s to “once in a while”. Youth A denies ever
getting marijuana from staff and states he would get money from
his “peoples” in the community and then purchase marijuana from
the gas station and used it in an unknown house. Youth A
remembers AWOLing from the facility on his birthday at
approximately 3:00PM and notes that Staff Person 1 worked the
third shift and was not present when he left the facility and did not
2

remember him being present when he arrived back at the facility.
Youth A states Staff Person 1 was “straight” and denies Staff
Person 1 giving him marijuana or any other gift for his birthday.
He states Staff Person 1 and other staff knew Youth A smoked
marijuana because Youth A states he usually came back to the
facility high from being AWOL. Youth A does state he got a cake
from his Case Worker the week prior to his birthday. It is noted
that Youth A asked who the referral source was at his current
placement.
I interviewed Staff Peron 1 onsite with DHHS Worker 2 on
05/25/2023. He reports being employed by the facility for five
months with no disciplinary issues. He does no recall Youth A
though remembers a resident getting a cake for his birthday. Staff
Person 1 denies giving Youth A or any other resident a gift and
denies purchasing marijuana for any residents as well. He does
not know of any staff that have purchased or given marijuana to
any residents as well. He states he usually works the 11PM-7AM
shift and does not recall if he worked a double shift on 01/10/2023.
I interviewed Youth’s B and C onsite with DHHS Worker 2 on
05/25/2023. Both report Staff Person 1 working the night shift and
would leave in the morning and report no problems with him.
They deny knowledge of him or other staff passing along
contraband to residents.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 onsite with DHHS Worker 2 on
05/25/2023. She reports having observed Staff Person 1 work
with the residents and states that he is a good role model for
them. She denies knowledge of him or other staff bringing the
residents contraband to include marijuana.
DHHS Worker reports having no findings.
Analysis There is no conclusive evidence to indicate Staff Person 1 of
providing Youth A with marijuana on his birthday. Youth A
truanted from the facility on his birthday at 3:00PM and did not
return to the facility until 1:00AM. Youth A denies Staff Person 1 of
giving him marijuana for his birthday and states he gets money
from his “peoples” in the community to purchase marijuana from
the gas station when he truants.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
No change to the current license is recommended.
06/27/2023
